channel.title: Need help portforwarding and Char files
channel.description:
Hello guys so i am in the process of making a server and i got the vast majority of it done all i need to do i portforward it. I also ran into a couple of problems.. One of the problems is that the Character files are like tripping out so to say.. Instead of it being all organized its litterally just a bunch of spam in the folder. My other problem is that i have an anti-leech in loaderhandler i believe. My coder removed it and wanted to send me the source that he coded but it was taking way to long since the cache was still in the folder.
Thanks for reading! My skype is: Gayboy3331 I'd really prefer if you had teamviewer as well only because i am a total noob with computers.. lol :)

item.title: Need help portforwarding and Char files
item.dc:creator: @darkhero40 darkhero40
item.description:
@darkhero40 wrote:

Oh ok bro to change characters files if its a PI i can remember if its a PI server go in playersave.java you can make it way neater/cleaner in there hope it HELPS!

Read full topic

item.title: Need help portforwarding and Char files
item.dc:creator: @darkhero40 darkhero40
item.description:
@darkhero40 wrote:

Im going to have to say if you are 100% sure you did everything right your firewall if probably not allowing you to open it and I dont know how to unblock it if possible so sorry man

Read full topic

item.title: Need help portforwarding and Char files
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

I can take a look and if it looks like everything is done right then my guess would be that your internet provider does not allow ports 43594 to be opened or portforwarding at all or maybe your no-ip is deactivated from no use for awhile?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help portforwarding and Char files
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Have you tried this http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Linksys/E2500/Runescape_Private_Server.htm where it says to ip address put your ipv4 address there from the command prompt and it should be working now. Allow ports TCP UDP 43594 to your firewall

Read full topic
